etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Encyclopaedia Metropolitana. From vegetable + -ize

definitions: To convert into, or cause to resemble, a vegetable substance; to make or render vegetable.
To lose interest in or capacity for intellectual or social activity.
To render (a person) docile or passive by impairing his or her intellectual function, usually as a means of treating violent behaviour, drug addiction, etc. Also in extended use.
